page.title: 10GATESHEAD METRO STATION
page.content: The Gateshead Metro Station is an important part of the{integrated {passenger transport system}on Tyneside which involvles a railway system, buses and ferries. The system was opened in November 1980 by H.M.Queen ElizabethII. The{Gateshead interchange is very busy with thousands of{ {commuters}and{shoppers}passing through it and more than{135 buses}every hour. Passenger safety is vitally important and we saw for ourselves how efficient the system is when 3 fire tenders arrived within{2}minutes of an alarm being sounded. The platforms are more than 90 feet underground and the station was excavated from the site of an old sandstone quarry. As the tunnels were being built the engineers had to be very careful because they were in an area of unmapped old mine workings.
